Message.Issue: 'AppViewModel' contains field 'AppViewModel.<RuleSelector>k__BackingField' that is of IDisposable type: 'RuleSelector'. Change the Dispose method on 'AppViewModel' to call Dispose or Close on this field.

'RuleSelector.RuleSelector(IObservable<dynamic>, IObservable<Grammar>)' is coupled with 44 different types from 15 different namespaces. Rewrite or refactor the method to decrease its class coupling, or consider moving the method to one of the other types it is tightly coupled with. A class coupling above 40 indicates poor maintainability, a class coupling between 40 and 30 indicates moderate maintainability, and a class coupling below 30 indicates good maintainability.
Correct the spelling of 'Entrypoints' in member name 'RuleSelector.Entrypoints' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of 'Entrypoint' in member name 'RuleSelector.SelectedEntrypoint' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of 'Entrypoints' in member name 'RuleSelector.SelectedEntrypoints' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.

Because the behavior of 'string.Format(string, object, object)' could vary based on the current user's locale settings, replace this call in 'TestParser.WarningsPerformanceTracer.ReportPerformance(TimeSpan, PerformanceTracer.RulePerformanceInfo[])' with a call to 'string.Format(IFormatProvider, string, params object[])'. If the result of 'string.Format(IFormatProvider, string, params object[])' will be displayed to the user, specify 'CultureInfo.CurrentCulture' as the 'IFormatProvider' parameter. Otherwise, if the result will be stored and accessed by software, such as when it is persisted to disk or to a database, specify 'CultureInfo.InvariantCulture'.

Because the behavior of 'string.Format(string, object, object)' could vary based on the current user's locale settings, replace this call in 'TestParser.WarningsPerformanceTracer.ReportPerformance(TimeSpan, PerformanceTracer.RulePerformanceInfo[])' with a call to 'string.Format(IFormatProvider, string, params object[])'. If the result of 'string.Format(IFormatProvider, string, params object[])' will be displayed to the user, specify 'CultureInfo.CurrentCulture' as the 'IFormatProvider' parameter. Otherwise, if the result will be stored and accessed by software, such as when it is persisted to disk or to a database, specify 'CultureInfo.InvariantCulture'.
Correct the spelling of 'Entrypoint' in type name 'ExportedRuleEntrypoint'.
Change the accessibility of all public constructors in 'ParserEntrypoint' to protected.
Correct the spelling of 'Entrypoint' in type name 'ParserEntrypoint'.
In member 'ParserEntrypoint.Parse(string, string, ITracer)', the discrete term 'filename' in parameter name 'filename' should be expressed as a compound word, 'fileName'.
Correct the spelling of 'Entrypoint' in type name 'PublicRuleEntrypoint'.
Correct the spelling of 'Entrypoint' in type name 'StartRuleEntrypoint'.

Rule.Name: Abstract types should not have constructors
Rule.Description: Public constructors for abstract types do not make sense because you cannot create instances of abstract types.
Rule.Resolution: Change the accessibility of all public constructors in {0} to protected.

Rule.Name: Avoid excessive class coupling
Rule.Description: Types and methods with a high degree of class coupling can be difficult to maintain.
Rule.Resolution: {0} is coupled with {1} different types from {2} different namespaces. Rewrite or refactor the method to decrease its class coupling, or consider moving the method to one of the other types it is tightly coupled with. A class coupling above {3} indicates poor maintainability, a class coupling between {3} and {4} indicates moderate maintainability, and a class coupling below {4} indicates good maintainability.

Rule.Name: Compound words should be cased correctly
Rule.Description: Avoid creating compound words from terms which exist in the dictionary as discrete terms. Do not create a compound word such as 'StopWatch' or 'PopUp'. These terms are recognized in the dictionary and should be cased as 'Stopwatch' and 'Popup'.
Rule.Resolution: In member {0}, the discrete term '{1}' in parameter name {2} should be expressed as a compound word, '{3}'.

Rule.Name: Disposable fields should be disposed
Rule.Description: If a type that implements IDisposable owns fields that also implement IDisposable, the encapsulating type's Dispose() implementation should call Dispose() on each disposable field.
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains field {1} that is of IDisposable type: {2}. Change the Dispose method on {0} to call Dispose or Close on this field.

Rule.Name: Identifiers should be spelled correctly
Rule.Description: The individual words that make up an identifier should not be abbreviated and should be spelled correctly. If this rule generates a false positive on a term that should be recognized, add the word to the FxCop custom dictionary.
Rule.Resolution: Correct the spelling of '{0}' in member name {1} or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of '{0}' in type name {1}.

Rule.Name: Specify IFormatProvider
Rule.Description: If an overload exists that takes an IFormatProvider argument, it should always be called in favor of an overload that does not. Some methods in the runtime convert a value to or from a string representation and take a string parameter that contains one or more characters, called format specifiers, which indicate how the value is to be converted. If the meaning of the format specifier varies by culture, a formatting object supplies the actual characters used in the string representation. In scenarios where sorting and comparison behavior should never change between cultures, specify CultureInfo.InvariantCulture, otherwise, specify CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.
Rule.Resolution: Because the behavior of {0} could vary based on the current user's locale settings, replace this call in {1} with a call to {2}. If the result of {2} will be displayed to the user, specify {3} as the 'IFormatProvider' parameter. Otherwise, if the result will be stored and accessed by software, such as when it is persisted to disk or to a database, specify {4}.
